papers.summary: The key insight is to leverage agreement among the specialized experts to select the best answer for each question, or to abstain from answering, which gives MoRE higher accuracy than any single specialized model on a collection of 12 QA datasets from four reasoning types.

papers.title: Code Prompting: a Neural Symbolic Method for Complex Reasoning in Large Language Models
papers.authors: Y. Hu,Haotong Yang,Zhouchen Lin,Muhan Zhang
papers.summary: This work explores code prompting, a neural symbolic prompting method with both zero-shot and few-shot versions which triggers code as intermediate steps, and performs extensive ablation studies and error analyses and identifies several exclusive advantages of using symbolic promptings compared to natural language.

papers.title: Leveraging Training Data in Few-Shot Prompting for Numerical Reasoning
papers.venue: Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
papers.authors: Zhanming Jie,Wei Lu
papers.summary: The results suggest that leveraging a large amount of training data can improve the generalization ability of prompts and boost the performance of fine-tuned small models in MWP solving.

papers.title: World Models for Math Story Problems
papers.venue: Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics
papers.authors: Andreas Opedal,Niklas Stoehr,Abulhair Saparov,Mrinmaya Sachan
papers.summary: This paper consolidates previous work on categorizing and representing math story problems and develops MathWorld, which is a graph-based semantic formalism specific for the domain of math story Problems, which represents the situations and actions introduced in the text and their mathematical relationships.

papers.title: MinT: Boosting Generalization in Mathematical Reasoning via Multi-View Fine-Tuning
papers.authors: Zhenwen Liang,Dian Yu,Xiaoman Pan,Wenlin Yao,Qingkai Zeng,Xiangliang Zhang,Dong Yu
papers.summary: This work introduces a multi-view fine-tuning method that efficiently exploits existing mathematical problem datasets with diverse annotation styles, and uniquely considers the various annotation formats as different"views" and leverages them in training the model.

papers.title: ARB: Advanced Reasoning Benchmark for Large Language Models
papers.authors: Tomohiro Sawada,Daniel Paleka,Alex Havrilla,Pranav Tadepalli,Paula Vidas,Alexander Kranias,John J. Nay,Kshitij Gupta,Aran Komatsuzaki
papers.summary: This work introduces ARB, a novel benchmark composed of advanced reasoning problems in multiple fields, featuring problems in mathematics, physics, biology, chemistry, and law, and introduces a rubric-based evaluation approach, allowing GPT-4 to score its own intermediate reasoning steps.

papers.title: Scaling Relationship on Learning Mathematical Reasoning with Large Language Models
papers.authors: Zheng Yuan,Hongyi Yuan,Cheng Li,Guanting Dong,Chuanqi Tan,Chang Zhou
papers.summary: It is found that pre-training loss is a better indicator of the model's performance than the model’s parameter count and that with augmented samples containing more distinct reasoning paths, RFT improves mathematical reasoning performance more for LLMs.

papers.title: Guiding Mathematical Reasoning via Mastering Commonsense Formula Knowledge
papers.authors: Jia-Yin Liu,Zhenya Huang,Zhiyuan Ma,Qi Liu,Enhong Chen,Tianhuang Su,Haifeng Liu
papers.summary: A novel Formula-mastered Solver (FOMAS) is established with two systems drawing insight from the dual process theory, including a Knowledge System and a Reasoning System, to learn and apply formula knowledge, respectively to improve both reasoning accuracy and interpretability.

papers.title: MathAttack: Attacking Large Language Models Towards Math Solving Ability
papers.authors: Zihao Zhou,Qiufeng Wang,Mingyu Jin,Jie Yao,Jianan Ye,Wei Liu,Wei Wang,Xiaowei Huang,Kaizhu Huang
papers.summary: This work proposes a MathAttack model to attack MWP samples which are closer to the essence of security in solving math problems, and proposes a new dataset RobustMath to evaluate the robustness of LLMs in math solving ability.

papers.title: Contrastive Decoding Improves Reasoning in Large Language Models
papers.authors: Sean O'Brien,Mike Lewis
papers.summary: Overall, Contrastive Decoding outperforms nucleus sampling for long-form generation and greedy decoding for reasoning tasks, making it a powerful general purpose method for generating text from language models.

papers.title: Promptbreeder: Self-Referential Self-Improvement Via Prompt Evolution
papers.authors: Chrisantha Fernando,D. Banarse,Henryk Michalewski,Simon Osindero,Tim Rocktäschel
papers.summary: Promptbreeder is a general-purpose self-referential self-improvement mechanism that evolves and adapts prompts for a given domain and outperforms state-of-the-art prompt strategies such as Chain- of-Thought and Plan-and-Solve Prompting on commonly used arithmetic and commonsense reasoning benchmarks.

papers.title: L2CEval: Evaluating Language-to-Code Generation Capabilities of Large Language Models
papers.authors: Ansong Ni,Pengcheng Yin,Yilun Zhao,Martin Riddell,Troy Feng,Rui Shen,Stephen Yin,Ye Liu,Semih Yavuz,Caiming Xiong,Shafiq R. Joty,Yingbo Zhou,Dragomir R. Radev,Arman Cohan
papers.summary: This work presents L2CEval, a systematic evaluation of the language-to-code generation capabilities of LLMs on 7 tasks across the domain spectrum of semantic parsing, math reasoning and Python programming, analyzing the factors that potentially affect their performance.

papers.title: Corex: Pushing the Boundaries of Complex Reasoning through Multi-Model Collaboration
papers.authors: Qiushi Sun,Zhangyue Yin,Xiang Li,Zhiyong Wu,Xipeng Qiu,Lingpeng Kong
papers.summary: This paper introduces Corex, a suite of novel general-purpose strategies that transform LLMs into autonomous agents pioneering multi-model collaborations for complex task-solving, and demonstrates the cost-effectiveness of the method, facilitating collaboration among different LLMs and promoting annotation efficiency.

papers.title: An Expression Tree Decoding Strategy for Mathematical Equation Generation
papers.authors: Wenqi Zhang,Yongliang Shen,Qingpeng Nong,Zeqi Tan Yanna Ma,Weiming Lu
papers.summary: This work integrates tree structure into the expression-level generation and advocates an expression tree decoding strategy, and shows that this method outperforms other baselines, especially for these equations with complex structures.

papers.title: TRIGO: Benchmarking Formal Mathematical Proof Reduction for Generative Language Models
papers.authors: Jing Xiong,Jianhao Shen,Ye Yuan,Haiming Wang,Yichun Yin,Zhengying Liu,Lin Li,Zhijiang Guo,Qingxing Cao,Yinya Huang,Chuanyang Zheng,Xiaodan Liang,Ming Zhang,Qun Liu
papers.summary: This work proposes TRIGO, an ATP benchmark that not only requires a model to reduce a trigonometric expression with step-by-step proofs but also evaluates a generative LM's reasoning ability on formulas and its capability to manipulate, group, and factor number terms.

papers.title: Eliminating Reasoning via Inferring with Planning: A New Framework to Guide LLMs' Non-linear Thinking
papers.authors: Yongqi Tong,Yifan Wang,Dawei Li,Sizhe Wang,Zi Lin,Simeng Han,Jingbo Shang
papers.summary: This work proposes IEP, a novel prompting that combines the principles of elimination and inference in order to guide LLMs to think non-linearly and observes that integrating IEP and CoT further improves the LLMs' performance on certain tasks, highlighting the necessity of equipping LLMs with mixed logic processes.

papers.title: Defining a New NLP Playground
papers.authors: Sha Li,Chi Han,Pengfei Yu,Carl N. Edwards,Manling Li,Xingyao Wang,Y. Fung,Charles Yu,Joel R. Tetreault,Eduard H. Hovy,Heng Ji
papers.summary: This paper aims to define a new NLP playground by proposing 20+ PhD-dissertation-worthy research directions, covering theoretical analysis, new and challenging problems, learning paradigms, and interdisciplinary applications.

papers.title: Perturbation-based Active Learning for Question Answering
papers.authors: Fan Luo,M. Surdeanu
papers.summary: This work proposes a perturbation-based active learning acquisition strategy and demonstrates it is more effective than existing commonly used strategies.

papers.title: On the Abilities of Mathematical Extrapolation with Implicit Models
papers.authors: Juliette Decugis,Max Emerling,Ashwin Ganesh,Alicia Y. Tsai,L. Ghaoui
papers.summary: This paper compares the robustness of implicitly-defined and classical deep learning models on a series of mathematical extrapolation tasks, where the models are tested with out-of-distribution samples during inference time to showcase implicit models’ unique advantages for mathematics extrapolation thanks to their flexible and selective framework.

papers.title: One Clinician Is All You Need–Cardiac Magnetic Resonance Imaging Measurement Extraction: Deep Learning Algorithm Development
papers.authors: Pulkit Singh,Julian S Haimovich,C. Reeder,S. Khurshid,S. Emily,Lau,Jonathan W Cunningham,A. Philippakis,C. D. Anderson,J. Ho,S. Lubitz,P. Batra
papers.summary: This study demonstrated that a domain-agnostic pretrained transformer model is able to effectively extract quantitative clinical measurements from diagnostic reports with a relatively small number of gold-standard annotations.

papers.title: JRIRD at the NTCIR-16 FinNum-3 Task: Investigating the Effect of Numerical Representations in Manager’s Claim Detection
papers.authors: Shunsuke Onuma,Kazuma Kadowaki

papers.title: Innovations in Neural Data-to-text Generation
papers.authors: Mandar Sharma,Ajay K. Gogineni,Naren Ramakrishnan
papers.summary: This survey draws boundaries separating DTG from the rest of the natural language generation (NLG) landscape, encompassing an up-to-date synthesis of the literature, and highlighting the stages of technological adoption from within and outside the greater NLG umbrella.

papers.title: Towards Efficient and Robust Out-of-Distribution Deep Learning with Implicit Models
papers.authors: Ashwin Ganesh
papers.summary: This paper shows how to decrease implicit model training time by harnessing the state-driven implicit modeling framework to safely eliminate features while maintaining model accuracy.

papers.title: Exploring Generalization Ability of Pretrained Language Models on Arithmetic and Logical Reasoning
papers.venue: Natural Language Processing and Chinese Computing
papers.authors: Cunxiang Wang,Boyuan Zheng,Y. Niu,Yue Zhang
papers.summary: This research finds that the PLMs can easily generalize when the distribution is the same, however, it is still difficult for them to generalize out of the distribution.

papers.title: Symbolic Brittleness in Sequence Models: on Systematic Generalization in Symbolic Mathematics
papers.authors: S. Welleck,Peter West,Jize Cao,Yejin Choi
papers.summary: A methodology for evaluating generalization that takes advantage of the problem domain's structure and access to a verifier is developed, and the problem of symbolic mathematical integration is considered, as it requires generalizing systematically beyond the training set.

papers.title: Compositional Attention: Disentangling Search and Retrieval
papers.authors: Sarthak Mittal,Sharath Chandra Raparthy,I. Rish,Yoshua Bengio,Guillaume Lajoie
papers.summary: This work proposes a novel attention mechanism, called Compositional Attention, that replaces the standard head structure, and demonstrates that it outperforms standard multi-head attention on a variety of tasks, including some out-of-distribution settings.
